thing-type.label: NQ-9022 Electrical Meter
thing-type.description:
Electrical Meter

Overview

The basic purpose of the device is to count impulses / flashes from a metering device and to save impulse count in nonvolatile memory with 15 minutes interval.


Inclusion Information

3 times press on the button to include


Exclusion Information

3 times press on the button to exclude


Wakeup Information

Press the sensor button 1 time to enter Wakeup (real-time) mode

parameter.name: config_1_4
parameter.label: 1: Pulse factor
parameter.description: Impulse or Rotation factor per KWh * 10

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: IR Listen period
parameter.description: Additional time for feedback measurement. Should always be 0.

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: IR Pulse Width
parameter.description:
Adjusts transmit signal

Overview

Adjusts transmit signal so received signal will in average be equal to this values.

parameter.name: config_5_1
parameter.label: 5: Poll / Wake up frequency
parameter.description:
Wake device up this many times per second.

Overview

This value also controls number of measurements per second on mechanical meters.

parameter.name: config_6_1
parameter.label: 6: Pulse Threshold Low
parameter.description: Low detection threshold for wheel meters

parameter.name: config_7_1
parameter.label: 7: Pulse Threshold High
parameter.description: High detection threshold for wheel meters

parameter.name: config_9_4
parameter.label: 9: Pulse count
parameter.description: Total pulse count (Meter reading / impulse factor)

parameter.name: config_10_2
parameter.label: 10: Keep alive period
parameter.description: How many seconds before going back to sleep in normal wakeup mode.

parameter.name: config_11_2
parameter.label: 11: Real-time mode
parameter.description:
Set this to enter real-time mode from remote.

Overview

Contains seconds * poll frequency before going back to sleep. If you press the button once this value will be set.

parameter.name: config_15_4
parameter.label: 15: Calibration status
parameter.description:
The calibration progress is calculated

Overview

The calibration progress is calculated as (value[1] - 65 + value[2] / value[3]) * 25.

The calibration is finished successfully when value[0]  =  2 and value[2] = value[3].
